English: to abandon, leave, forsake, give up
to be accustomed, be in the habit of
to knife, cut, cut open, slash
to advance, front, keep on, progress, go ahead
to grab, seize, grasp, get hold of
to shake up, agitate, stir up, wave
to endure, tolerate, put up with
to support, back, favor, lean on
to arrange, set in order, settle, repair, adjust
to vacuum, inhale, breathe in, draw
to augment, increase, magnify, gain weight
to tire out, get tired, become weary
to swing, sway, play on a swing-set
to conserve, save, maintain in some condition
to shriek, squeak, scream, shout, screech
to leave, let, leave alone, let stand
to despise, condemn, look down on
to put in, throw, cast, fling, put
to soil, get dirty, stain, pollute
to enter, join a group, become a member
to hammer, pound with a hammer
to opine, to be of the opinion
to stand, come to a stand-still, stop
to last, last a long time
to toot, honk, blow a whistle, whistle
to remove, take off, take away
to return, go back, give back
to wave, signal, stamp, show, point out, indicate
to tolerate, put up with, endure
to move, transfer, remove (from one place to another)
to give a shoe to, kick
